node.doctext:
This is a storage node for CST reviews. Reviews are moved here from our working area in [CST_Chat].

This archive begins on , When it's full we'll move to [CST_Storage_26].

See also CST Storage collabs [CST_Storage_1|1] - [CST_Storage_24|24].

Batch Processed on:
=================================================
Batch Processed on: 06/20/07

Writeup Title:[I wanna be your dog]
Author:[FryingLizard]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 54%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2007-05-27@22:57 Lord Brawl]says [I wanna be your dog](2) seems inadequately annotated.
Hello FryingLizard, Unfortunately due to the [E2 copyright changes] E2 can no longer keep copyrighted works in its database. If you would like to update this and resubmit it you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for suggestions and ideas. If you have any questions please feel free to contact an editor or myself and we will be happy to assist. :)

Hello NothingLasts4ever, This write up was submitted for a [Content_salvage|CST Review]. I hope you don’t mind that I added an editor note to meet Ice Nine’s request for credit. You may add the [CST Approved] tag if you would like to. :)
Oops! Just noticed the copyright credit and removed my note. I’m sorry for the confusion.

Writeup Title: [War and Peace]
Author: [GoodKingNerdnor]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: Yes
Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: Yes
Compliance Assessment: Yes
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2007.03.22 at 05:08 Excalibre says The entire text of War and Peace is noded but the noder doesn't indicate the translator and says the date of translation is "unknown as of yet" (nearly six years after noding!) So the translation might well still be copyright.
Hi there, Good news, this writeup appears to be fully compliant with the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|E2 Copyright Policy]. Please cite [Project Gutenberg] as a source and feel free to add the [CST Approved] tag if you like.
The [Project Gutenberg] version of War and Peace is in the public domain and may be cited as a copyright-free source.
GoodKingNerdnor says I know it's copywrite compliant, but... what the hell is project gutenberg?
/msg GoodKingNerdnor Without a citation for a public domain source, your [War and Peace |writeups] aren't compliant. Google [Project Gutenberg] is one such source you can cite. Make sense?
2007-04-14 (2.1 hr) GoodKingNerdnor says Alright, I understand some need for compliance, but I have two questions: one, as the novel is in the public domain, why isn't Tolstoy himself a good enough source? two - seeing as I didn't get it from Project Gutenberg (I was actually scanning the book and using OCR. Essentially this was a project that made me read the novel) would it not be wrong to cite it?
Publishers pay authors for the right to print an edition of a work. The publisher then owns the copyright for that edition. If you scanned an edition that is under copyright, you are violating their rights. If you use a public domain version of the work, like Project Gutenberg, you are okay. Your call, but I have to remove the writeups if you cite a copyrighted source. 2007-04-23 (1.2 hr) GoodKingNerdnor says That would be significantly faster than what I had been doing. I do intend to finish adding chapters. I've edited the bottom and cited PG.

Writeup Title:[ Gay/Not Gay]
Author:[WolfDaddy]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 55%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2007-03-22@4:26 [Excalibre] says [gay/not gay] is almost certainly not complaint (see wolfdaddy's e2 nuke request for details - it's lyrics, and he's sought permission but they've never responded.) I thought you guys should handle this, though.

[WolfDaddy]’s deletion request Mon Mar 19 2007 at 17:46:17 “As much as I hate to do this, I'm submitting [Gay/Not Gay] for consideration for deletion. Multiple requests for permission to use the lyrics have been sent, all unanswered. It's been four years. I think we have our answer. Or a bunch of apathy. Your choice.

For fairness' (and fair use) sake, I should include that I believe that many folk 'round here consider the formatting and linking to be what makes--or, perhaps more correctly, made--the node worthy of keeping.

I therefore leave it up to those more informed about current e2 policy (and copyright issues) to decide whether the node should stay or go. Thank you for your time and effort!

I would very much like to see it stay, particularly for the formatting and so on. However, it's essentially a CST decision, right? - [XWiz]


Hello WolfDaddy, Unfortunately the lyrics to [Gay/Not Gay] are copyrighted and do not me the current standards in the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. For the record some people would like to see this write up resubmitted. The best way to do that would be to add enough original content to meet [fair use]. If you feel that the formatting exceeds the creativity of the original work enough to garner copyright you may want to consider submitting it to the copyright office noted in the FAQ. Another idea would be to ask for an exemption from [Lord Brawl] with the idea in mind that if the copyright holders ask E2 to remove it we would do so immediately. I’m deleting it now per your nuke request. Lord Brawl can resurrect it if you guys come to an agreement. Good luck! CC: [Lord Brawl].
2007-03-22@21:17 [WolfDaddy] says Dearest Lometa, thanks for the detailed response on Gay/Not Gay. I think I'll let it stay in Node Heaven. Thanks! (uh, cc: [Lord Brawl] :-)

Aand on things like high-level radioactive waste, where it's not at all clear that the wu is c&p, if it IS legal noding material, could we make it more clear (ed. note?) that it's not his original words?
/msg jessicapierce Hi there Jess, Re. [Radionuclide], the DOE pubs are public domain and they're cited, so the wus are technically copyright compliant. It's your call on their overall worthiness.
